pr_title: Fixed bug in file share source url encoding

timeline.message: Fixed bug in source url encoding

timeline.bodyText: Does anyone have a better idea on a name for this method?
timeline.author: gapra-msft

timeline.bodyText: can we have more / in the path ? if yes then should we encode them?
timeline.author: kasobol-msft

replies.bodyText: This particular if case is because when you call getPath, it returns the path including the starting /. Then when you do setPath for some reason, it makes the URL have two slashes - so I'm just trying to prevent that error from happening. Does that make sense?
replies.author: gapra-msft

replies.bodyText:
That's not what I meant. Please take a look on this sample url 
  
    
      azure-sdk-for-java/sdk/storage/azure-storage-blob/src/test/resources/session-records/BlobAPITestcopysourceac[4].json
    
    
         Line 95
      in
      6e23e4a
    
    
    
    

        
          
           "x-ms-copy-source" : "https://azstoragesdkaccount.blob.core.windows.net/jtccopysourceac0blobapitestcopysourceac26775340db315343/javablobcopysourceac1blobapitestcopysourceac26713808da3bf", 
        
    
  


https://azstoragesdkaccount.blob.core.windows.net/jtccopysourceac0blobapitestcopysourceac26775340db315343/javablobcopysourceac1blobapitestcopysourceac26713808da3bf .
the last / in this url is going to be encoded into %2F I think. Shouldn't we split path by / before encoding and just transform segments ?
replies.author: kasobol-msft

replies.bodyText: Oh. Both are equivalent as per the service so it shouldnt matter
replies.author: gapra-msft

replies.bodyText: Do we have a test covering that?
replies.author: kasobol-msft

replies.bodyText: The fact that the tests work is validation that they are the same since otherwise the service would come back with a 404 saying the source doesnt exist.
replies.author: gapra-msft

timeline.bodyText: do we have to decode it first ? Wouldn't already encoded chars be left alone during encoding?
timeline.author: kasobol-msft

replies.bodyText: We need to do this to preserve the case where a user has a URL that looks encoded. - Like if they pass in a url with hello%20hello - if we encode that it'll become hello(whatever % encoding is)20hello, which we don't want to do
replies.author: gapra-msft

timeline.bodyText: if copy source is passed as a parameter then shouldn't we just encode the whole thing ? I'm wondering why just path.
timeline.author: kasobol-msft

replies.bodyText: The problem with that is it will become an invalid URI since it will encode the :// in the protocol part and everything. :(
replies.author: gapra-msft
